website_summaries.verdict: A bit of a throwback in terms of design, but it provides a great shave and you can use inexpensive replacement blades.
pros: Very affordable, ergonomic and blades are held at the ideal angle for a close, comfortable shave
Blades are inexpensive as it uses common, double-edge blades
cons: If you are the type who wants the latest shaving technology, look elsewhere

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Value
customer_reviews.text: My primary razor is a Feather AS-D2 I got for Christmas. In my opinion, that's the finest razor there is. I got this as a travel razor and was shocked at the performance. The Popular is mostly plastic and much, much lighter than the AS-D2. It's also $10-20, while the AS-D2 is $175-200. For me the shave is remarkably similar. A truly enjoyable razor that delivers and excellent shave. I use feather Hi-Stainless blades exclusively in both and highly recommend the combination.
customer_reviews.author: d-calif

customer_reviews.title: So far so good! Fantastic for the price. Had expensive Mekur now blistering and unusable.
customer_reviews.text: Shame I spent so much money on what I was hoping was the standard German excellence in products. Bought an expensive Merkur and in less than a year, it's blistering all over under the chrome and is essentially unusable. I've been using this one from Feather as I'm an avid lover of their blades, and found it to be absolutely perfect. I was actually thinking about shelling out $200 for the top of the line Feather, but why? I can buy a case of these for the same money and they just seem excellent. Bought 3 and love them.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Beechcraft

customer_reviews.title: junk
customer_reviews.text: I've been wet shaving for over 10 years now. I've had a Murkur for all of that time and its been great. I was thinking about trying something new and I came upon this... It's Junk! Barely cuts any hair at once, must use excessive pressure for it to work at all and now Im getting razor burn from making so many passes trying to get close even shaves. If I shave with my regular safety razor first then come back to this one it does get closer, but thats ridiculous. Save your time and dime and just pass on by
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Good, different
customer_reviews.text: Ive been using this on and off for a few weeks. For blades I used a green derby, an astra and a feather blade. It definately needs a sharper blade like the feather or astra. I feel like you kinda have to use a little more pressure than you want to but it didnt cause any irritation. If youre used to a heavy razor its definately different but it works. I think it would be pretty good for switching from cart razors. Its pretty forgiving
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Bockius

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Tired is spending a fortune on disposable razors for your legs and don’t like to pollute the earth? Buy this razor! Super easy to load and discard razor. Feather razors very sharp, gave me a great shave and I didn’t even feel the blade. The only negative I could possibly say which isn’t that big a deal is that it’s a bit too too heavy but it is only plastic and for the price not that big of a deal. I know they make more heavier models but 5X’s the price. Overall excellent product. Very satisfied. Will buy more as gifts.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Leigh

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I have had many fine expensive razors, and while this one is lighter, it is an excellent performer. Feather double edge blades are extremely sharp, and perform far better than all that fancy dancy expensive stuff. Additionally both the blades & razor are made in Japan.........far better then items made in China or India. Pair up with some Trumper's shaving cream & you're all set. Might as well order some extra Feather blades.........you're gonna love them.
customer_reviews.author: Larry L. Emsweller

customer_reviews.title: Great shave, handles nicely, economical!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm really happy with this razor. I reluctantly returned to safety razor after years of disposable razor use. Cost forced me to rethink, at first bought cheap. The shave was OK, but it handled terribly, too short, slippery, and poor weight distribution. But this razor handles like a disposable (nice), with a much better shave and at a fraction of the cost. Best of all worlds.
customer_reviews.author: roger porter

customer_reviews.title: Great place to start for a switch to safety razors!
customer_reviews.text: A good step from disposable razors. This was my first safety razor and I loved it. Then I bought a Merkur and realized that there was a whole other level to the safety razor game. This is a great place to start though! Easy to change razor blades and nice long handle. Feather blades are the best I have used. Japan blades? Can't go wrong there. This is a great place to start if you want to move from a disposable razor, this easily rinses out and does not clog up with hair like the 4,5,6,7,8, etc etc cartridges do. Buy this and you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Boeck

customer_reviews.title: This is a GREAT razor and value...
customer_reviews.text: This will be my travel razor. It's excellent -- simple, well-made, and delivers a perfect shave with the Feather blades provided. The plastic case is very well designed -- with the lid shut, nothing rattles. The butterfly opening of this razor works very well. When the blade is secured, the exposure is uniform and just what's required for a close and safe shave. I highly recommend this razor. I am using it's all stainless steel big brother on a daily basis, but this is my travel razor. Feather knows what they're doing. For the price you pay, this is a STEAL.
customer_reviews.author: LTGAZ

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised.
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised when I got this razor. I expected metal construction (perhaps I didn’t read all of the information). Works as well as or better than some more expensive all metal razors that I own. The center portion (where you lower the blade) seem a little larger that my other razors. Result? Holds the blade tighter and more centered, so when closed, the is more evenly exposed on each edge of the razor. The closing mechanism’s location (at the top of the handle) doesn’t loosen.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So Far, So Good
customer_reviews.text: When I bought this razor from Amazon the price was less than $10; now I see the price has doubled. At $10 you can’t go wrong with this razor: it shaves smoothly, comfortably, and closely with multiple passes. It is very light to hold, and has great ergonomics. The long handle is an asset, and has an effective non-slip design. The butterfly doors operate smoothly and hold the blade firmly in place. I can’t comment on the longevity of this razor, since I’ve had it only a short time, but so far I am very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Gerry

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply Constructed, Poor Shave
customer_reviews.text: I had very high hopes for this Japanese shaving brand staple. Unfortunately, the shaving experience did not compare favorably with the high priced multi-blade cartridges I’ve used for years. I cannot recommend this shaver.
customer_reviews.author: Beach House DIY Guy

customer_reviews.title: first safety razor
customer_reviews.text: I got tired of the cartridge razors so I bought one of these. I had never used a safety razor before. The result of a shave is much better than with a cartridge. This razor came with Feather blades, which are excellent. I later got some Rapira blades and those work very well with this razor at a fraction of the cost of other blades. For the price, this Feather razor is a very good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Harlan

customer_reviews.title: I'm glad I bought it
customer_reviews.text: I've always used regular cartridge razors and this is my first double-edged safety razor. It's simple to install the replacement blades and provides me with a very smooth, close shave with fewer occurrences of razor burns than with my previous cartridge razors. It's light-weight and reasonably priced compared to other razors of this type. I'm glad I bought it. I would say that there's a slight learning curve in adjusting to this type of razor though but I'm getting the hang of it now. The first time I used it, I had so many bleeding nicks on my face that I looked like the loser of a bare knuckle fight. OW.
customer_reviews.author: Chris D

customer_reviews.title: Made in JAPAN - Lightweight! (Plastic is not a bad thing in this case!)
customer_reviews.text: How did you find my reviews? Are you looking to switch to old timey safety razors but Walmart is charging you $17 for a made in china but chrome handle?? That is a waste of money. Buy, this and then buy a 50 pack of feather razors for $10 dollars because you are about to feel like owning a Gillette Mach 5 with this bad boy. best $20 I've ever spent and I'll have enough razors for the house all year.
customer_reviews.author: Francis

customer_reviews.title: Great razor for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Feather Popular, looking for a cheap TTO travel razor. This fits the bill perfectly. It's mild, lightweight and maneuverable when shaving. It is mostly made of plastic, but for the price as a TTO you can't beat it. This razor is great for anyone looking to start shaving with a safety razor, for those looking for a comfortable, mild shave, or someone looking for a backup or travel razor.
customer_reviews.author: Eric S Blau

customer_reviews.title: Best safety razor in my collection
customer_reviews.text: I have a few high dollar German made razors and bought this on a whim thinking, well I could use it for travel or something. It turns out to be the best razor I’ve ever used. With pre-oil, and a little bit of shave cream it gives me a great shave with much almost no skin irritation. I use the Feather blades in it. At first I wished it looked like one of my expensive razors, but I don’t care anymore. It is the only razor I want to use.
customer_reviews.author: Victor D. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Silky smooth
customer_reviews.text: For a plastic and metal double edged safety razor this one here is a hands down no blood winner, I think if the shaving is consistent I will be buying the high end Feather Razor, for a bottom end safety razor this one is without a doubt the best I have used, great shave, no nicks or cuts, zero blood, actually took all three passes for the very first time, darn it Feather! I see an AS-D2 in my future!
customer_reviews.author: Paul K. Ebert

customer_reviews.title: Great razor
customer_reviews.text: This is a feather razor meant to hold feather blades. It will hold others but feather is the best. That said this razor is not for beginners in my opinion. I’m a seasoned wet shaver and I nicked myself 5x. For the good shaver (not me it seems) you’ll be fine love the long handle plus light weight.
customer_reviews.author: crosby23

customer_reviews.title: Good for starters.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good DE razor - nothing sexy about it, it shaves. Not intended as a premium item, so folks shouldn't expect premium performance. Kind of like a Bic is a perfectly good pen, but it'll never write anything like a Cross or Mont Blanc. Great razor if you're trying to figure out if you want to get into using a DE razor. If you like shave it gives you, just imagine what a premium brand might do for you.
customer_reviews.author: amazon_shopper

customer_reviews.title: Could be better.
customer_reviews.text: I cannot get this razor to cut the hairs under my nose or around my ears reliably without nicking myself. I prefer the Merkur Open Combs as it does not have these issues and can cut longer hair no problem without having to use an electric trimmer to shave the hairs short first.
customer_reviews.author: Yoduh

customer_reviews.title: Great razor
customer_reviews.text: Great razor, easy to use and control for a great shave. The butterfly opening makes changing blades super easy. Beginners will find the feather blades to be difficult to use. Feather blades are extremely sharp! I recommend using something less agressive like derby or shark blades until you are more experienced.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: Freakishly good shaves
customer_reviews.text: Solid razor that yields remarkably close shaves On one hand I can see now why people buy tons of other razors and blades, experimenting with angles and such. On the other I could be happy using this razor indefinitely, and would expect it to last almost that long too Previously (with a 3 or 5 blade razor) I would get ingrown hairs almost weekly. Since switching to this razor I've had one in 2 months
customer_reviews.author: Dwayne

customer_reviews.title: Impressive performance, big value
customer_reviews.text: I'm an old geezer with small hands and the size and weight of this razor are perfect for me. Nice balance, nice grip. The Japanese are fastidious when it comes to accuracy and precision in making parts and assembling the final product. (Their Seki Edge hair styling tool is amazing.) Even the box is sturdy, convenient and easy to open and close. This thing leaves my skin smooth, no sign of stubble. So I don't have to shave every day and I feel good about the environmental friendliness of it all. Works well with rich face soap. I haven't tried the enclosed Feather blades, my hands are not steady enough for ultra-sharp. Astra is fine for me.
customer_reviews.author: chinpoko

customer_reviews.title: Kinda sucks since I love their blades
customer_reviews.text: I got this one for a travel razor as I'm prone to losing things but it's more agressive than expected, couldn't seem to get it to not cause extra irritation. Haven't had this issue with my other safety razors. Kinda sucks since I love their blades! But what can you expect from their most budget friendly razor.
customer_reviews.author: Snowyjake

customer_reviews.title: This razor is terrible!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this razor on Amazons reccomendation. I've tried several different brands of blades in it, feather, personna, nacet etc. every blade i try still cuts up my face. Looking at this razor it is very cheaply made. terrible construction and guess what I can't return it. It is total garbage and is going in the garbage. What a croc!
customer_reviews.author: John Culver

customer_reviews.title: What was I thinking?
customer_reviews.text: It only took one shave to bring back all the bad memories of shaving with a double bladed safety razor. Don't get me wrong, the razor was good quality as safety razors go. Now I recall why I was so happy when I tried my first Schick injector razor, then the Gillette Trac II, then the Atra - they just kept getting better and more comfortable. I'm over being grouchy about the cost and complexity. The new razors are comfortable and risk free. Sticking with the Mach III for now.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: There are better cheaper razors out there....
customer_reviews.text: For being a much praised "Feather", I wasn't that impressed. Don't get me wrong, for what I use it for, traveling, it's fine, but it doesn't shave better than many of my other razors, including both of my low cost Lord razors (they are better buy any measure IMHO). I will add that I haven't tried any other blades that I do have (Sharks, Derby's, and more) - only the Feather blades that came with it. This is a light weight butterfly razor that works fine for me - taking on business trips. If I lose it or break it, it's not that big of a deal.
customer_reviews.author: P. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Get it now!
customer_reviews.text: In terms of sensitivity it beats the Merkur 34c hands down. No need to spend more $$$ when this plastic beauty can give your​ neck zero irritation, unless you probably decide to go with it's high end brother. Just stick a Feather blade inside and let it do its job because you'll have little to no cuts. It does magic in taming a notorious bloody blade, and you skin will thank you that. It doesn't give you the closest shave ever, but I'll take it's mildness over any ingrown hair.
customer_reviews.author: sweet

customer_reviews.title: and it's definitely a good budget razor
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as my first double edge safety razor, and it's definitely a good budget razor. I'm not sure if it's the feather blades or the razor itself, but it does tend to cause irritation after a couple months of use. I think it's because the razor itself started to degrade in quality because of the cheaper materials used. I found myself having to replace the blade more and more often to get a comfortable shave. I'd still recommend purchasing this if you're wanting to try DE shaving, but consider a less aggressive blade (feathers are the sharpest ones available, and dig into your skin whenever they hit a thick hair patch)
customer_reviews.author: Matt 12334

customer_reviews.title: Excellent razor for the money
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this razor as an attempt to go back to double edge razor shaving. Better for the environment and the wallet. Blades are less than 50 cents each if you buy Feather (the sharpest and best blades) from Amazon. This razor is perfect if you are thinking about doing the same. Takes some practice, but, plenty of You Tube videos out there to assist. Great razor that I will now use as my travel razor. I enjoy the double edge shaving so much I splurged and bought an Edwin-Jagger for $36 on Amazon for my everyday use. You cannot go wrong for the money on this one. I recommend Feather blades for use in this razor. Happy shaving!
customer_reviews.author: Albert Taccone

customer_reviews.title: Very smooth shave
customer_reviews.text: I also have the stainless steel Feather and very happy with the smooth shave. The handle is short so I purchased this butterfly double edge model because of the easier blade changing. It gives the same smooth shave with a longer handle that fits my hand better than the shorter handle.
customer_reviews.author: Cliff R

customer_reviews.title: Best used without razor as a child’s toy.
customer_reviews.text: Not a good shave. Best used without razor as a child’s toy.
customer_reviews.author: jared

customer_reviews.title: From a user of Merkur 34C
customer_reviews.text: This razor is mild, even with Feather blades. If you have skin problems like I do, look no further. Yes it weighs nothing, and yes, it looks cheap. But it doesn't irritate my skin like 34c on the third pass. What I do now is that I use 34c with Astra on the first pass, and finishing up with this. If you don't have heavy hair growth like me, look no further.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great First DE Razor
customer_reviews.text: I started using double edge safety razors about a year ago after many years of expensive cartridges. I now own an Edwin Jagger DE89, a Parker 96R, and this beauty (purchased in that order). I wouldn't trade my Edwin Jagger for anything, but the Feather "Popular" TTO is a close second and much preferred over the Parker. While this is a fairly light razor, I haven't had a problem getting a close shave using the included Feather blades. As others have mentioned, this is a very forgiving razor. Based on the ease of use and the price point, I can't think of a better razor for making the transition away from cartridges.
customer_reviews.author: RC

customer_reviews.title: Excellent razor, Excellent price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good starter razor for any one that is looking to enter the world of DE shaving. I personally started shaving with this razor myself, and although I have moved on, have always come back to it. Feather makes excellent shaving blades and this razor is made with that same quality as well. The razor holds the blade evenly and there is completely no movement when shaving with it. It has a bit of weight to it which is good but it very sturdy and will last a very long time if taken care of.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S.

customer_reviews.title: Better than dad"s
customer_reviews.text: Always used dad-style, heavy, short-handled metal type of shaver. This is strong yet lighter weight, high quality plastic and metal construction with a slightly longer handle. Had it for years now and it still like new. Clearly a better design. You don't need shave clubs. Buy one of these and a 50 count box of good blades (Super Max/ Blue Diamond/India).
customer_reviews.author: Ron L.

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Looks cheap, is cheap, but performs well. Mild razor, yet very efficient. Works great with Feather blades. The safety bar is positioned well and it's almost impossible to cut yourself. Excellent travel razor.
customer_reviews.author: shoppologist

customer_reviews.title: Hubby Approved!!
customer_reviews.text: Hubby loves this razor and has been using it consistently. He advised that he will repurchase it because he loves it because it does it’s job more effectively than the store bought razors. Conclusion: Buy it( Hubby approved)
customer_reviews.author: Tanee LaPooh

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: It’s not terrible for the price but I wouldn’t recommend this razor, I would instead recommend spending a bit more on a better razor. It has cheap plastic feeling, lots of overhang, not so great handle for gripping with wet hands, and makes a rattling noise when shaken. It is somewhat mild in terms of aggressiveness. Overall I’m not happy with it but it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Connor

customer_reviews.title: Great product and a great price
customer_reviews.text: This was my first DE razor and to this day I still reach for it when I'm in a rush since the butterfly mechanism is so easy to use quickly. Some people may not care for the plastic handle but it feels just fine to me. The metal parts seem to be made of surprisingly resilient stainless steel. I also use a Merkur "1904" (much heavier and much smaller) these days but the feather is a great product to learn DE shaving on and the case is handy for use when traveling. Be sure to clean it periodically!
customer_reviews.author: JNFoo

customer_reviews.title: Great value.
customer_reviews.text: I own a Merkur 34C and a Muhle R41. This is a great quality razor for the price. It is however very mild compared to the other razors I own. Its mild enough to shave against the grain on the mustache.....Something I will never do with the Muhle. After 3 passes, I still have a few spots that aren't baby face smooth. But still a great razor to add to your collection.
customer_reviews.author: CB1000RE

customer_reviews.title: Not for me - too light
customer_reviews.text: I could never get a consistent shave with this razor. It's too light and the plastic guard kind of "skips" across the skin. It seems well constructed, though I didn't really use it long enough to judge it's durability.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene Abel

customer_reviews.title: Just get it, worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Durable, weight feels good. 1st time use took it slow, no nicks at all. Easy to use, and it appears it'll last a very long time. Closest shave I've ever had on my face and arms. Very happy with the purchase, even more so with the amount of money I'll be saving versus buying those disposable razors! Oh yeah, and the environment thing as well. Your killing two birds with one stone, and you cant beat that. Stop thinking, just buy and try it out for yourself. Its $13 and some change, so stop being cheap!
customer_reviews.author: SecondCity1

customer_reviews.title: great!
customer_reviews.text: I just had my first shave with a double edge using this razor. As a rookie I chose this razor, which is reported to be very gentle, and paired with a Derby blade, also reported to be gentle. I have a fairly heavy beard, and many issues with irritation and bumps. I did a lot of research on technique, etc. Anyway, using this combo, some shaving oil, and starting out with a very clean face, I enjoyed the best shave ever. I went very slow, and was very careful. And my skin is much smoother than any shave before with no irritation. No cuts. I am frankly astonished by this. Very happy with this razor. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Michigan BADMO

customer_reviews.title: A great shave and value
customer_reviews.text: The razor is a great price for someone who's interested in trying double edged shaving, and the shave that it provides is probably the closest shave i have ever had. Not to mention that it come with a nice little case.
customer_reviews.author: The  Cannibal cadaver

customer_reviews.title: Beautifully designed double edged razor for a low price
customer_reviews.text: Previously used a GodFather Vikings Double Edge Razor (3X the price) and I like this one better. I love the open/close mechanism (rather than twisting the head which is dangerous) of this razor. I was worried about the plastic pieces but they are a very hard/sturdy plastic (not cheap or fragile by any means). I think this razor blade will last a very, very long time.
customer_reviews.author: Eisen

customer_reviews.title: Great razor
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to safety razors. Other ones that I have tried gave me a lot of nicks, this one was very mild. I did use pre- shave oil and their cream. I was so confident that I made 3 passes.
customer_reviews.author: Winston

customer_reviews.title: As good as my vintage razors
customer_reviews.text: I have about 12 Razors - SuperSpeeds, Techs, Kronas... This Feather Popular gives me as good a shave as any of my classics. I would say it most resembles my Kronas. If I lost all razors but this one, I would still be a happy shaver for the rest of my life. It is so affordable, I have a spare still in the package in case anything ever happens to my trusty Popular.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Good value DE safety razor. Includes a nice and useful case
customer_reviews.text: I bought this prior to getting the all stainless Feather AS-D2. I just wanted to see how I liked the shave before spending more. I'm keeping this Popular as a travel razor. The case that the razor came in is handy to put some blades and any razor in for travel. Most fancy razor cases are too big. This case is not too cumbersome for my shave bag.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: So Glade to be able to get my hands on this Razor
customer_reviews.text: Been shaving with these for years. Missed not having one for about 20 years (step-son lost the 2 I gave him) lost mine moving years ago. These Razors today do not come close in performance and costs are so high! Amercans don't make the razors, or blades anymore. This Razor is Japanese, great price. Funny the out sourced their blades to India, Indonisia & Thailand. I bought my blades from Thailand (Feather brand), I bought 10 packs of 5 to pack (50 blades), way cheaper to buy in large quanities. Anyways I will not have to worry about blades. Its been awhile, but I think shipping was free on both Items.
customer_reviews.author: B. Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Good starter/travel DE razor handle.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good starter DE razor handle. I recommend it for travel. Pros: 1. Lightweight, if that's what you want. 2. Sturdy construction, don't let the plastic fool you. 3. Comes in a handy case for travel. Does not rattle around. 4. Razor blades align perfectly. 5. Low-cost. So you won't feel bad if you forget it in a hotel room. Cons: 1. Lightweight, if that's not what you want. 2. Aesthetics: There are a lot of prettier models, particularly the all-metal ones. 3. Angle not really adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: Anand Bhardwaj

customer_reviews.title: Smooth
customer_reviews.text: If it was all metal I don’t think it t could be beat. Very mild shaver but that’s a good thing. I had to check if the blade was in it. After a 3 pass shave my skin was super smooth with no irritation.
customer_reviews.author: chrisgt

customer_reviews.title: Feels cheap and light
customer_reviews.text: The weight is way off on this... feels like a disposable razor. I'll probably use it as a backup since I can't return it. Luckily it was cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff L

customer_reviews.title: Great for sensitive skin
customer_reviews.text: It’s very light and it feels plasticky. However, it’s also great for sensitive skin like mine and you won’t get an irritating feeling or minor cuts after your shave. For me, the best shave is in the shower. Great overall.
customer_reviews.author: G. Ibarra

customer_reviews.title: these are great. i like this style razor and my solid ...
customer_reviews.text: these are great. i like this style razor and my solid metal one would always get jammed and wouldnt open and it was dangerous because i had to grab it by the dang blade to open it. finally it jammed up completely and i bought one of these. since i did i have ordered 2 more as gifts. well built and easy to open and safe because you twist below the blade not by the blade. the feather brand blades are also very nice
customer_reviews.author: Mark Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good double-edged razor for klutzes like me
customer_reviews.text: The long handle and very light construction make it easy to control, and blades seem to rust more slowly in it than in my Van der Hagen razor (maybe because the head is mostly plastic?). Doesn't shave quite as close as the Van der Hagen, but much easier to use without cutting myself, and irritates my skin less. Seems like a good choice for people (like me) who are shaving a lot more than just their faces.
customer_reviews.author: TheFluffness

customer_reviews.title: Great razor
customer_reviews.text: Ive been using these for yrs. My old one was warn out so thought I'd try this brand. It works better than my old one ever did.
customer_reviews.author: Canon54

customer_reviews.title: I really hate to say it but I was not impressed
customer_reviews.text: I really hate to say it but I was not impressed. My Merkur 38c outperforms this thing 10:1 (but is also 3x as expensive). I'd hoped to use this to get a feel for their top of the line razor (about $300 if I recall). I'd hoped this would be a cheaply built but similarly performing razor. Nope. Horrible shave to be honest, very irritating. Very happy I was able to try it though, especially since it was so inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: N4784A

customer_reviews.title: A very good razor for practical men who just want a decent shave.
customer_reviews.text: All the razor a serious double-edge user who just wants a close, smooth, comfortable shave needs, at a very good price for the value. It is my everyday razor now, having supplanted my Gillette Black Beauty adjustable and sundry disposables. It works very well with Feather blades (mine came supplied with two) but I've used it with Walgreens store brand blades, also, with satisfactory results.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent handle and unbeatable price!
customer_reviews.text: You don't need to spend a bundle for a quality safety razor. You can, I've seen me do it, but you don't need to. This handle gives a great shave with Feather blades and comes with a storage case. I use it on both my face and to shave my head. The only point I would call to your attention is that it can get slippery if you use shaving oil like I do. If you use soap or cream, you won't have a worry.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Stark

customer_reviews.title: a $$$$ razor will probably be better than a $$ razor
customer_reviews.text: If you're not going to read reviews and buy a DE razor, buy this one. There's no point in buying a razor based on reviews because someone will not pick anything about anything. Sure, a $$$$ razor will probably be better than a $$ razor, but is it worth it? This one has a plastic handle, but the important part is metal.. The weight of this thing is comparable to most cartridge razors, so unless your saving down a Forrest, you'll be alright. I'll add anything else to this in a week if my opinion changes
customer_reviews.author: Evan F.

customer_reviews.title: Solid safety razor for the price.
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. My review will change when this product breaks (and I feel it will in time) to represent the value over time I received from it. But, it is holding up strong for now, and the value is solid until it fails. Down the line, I want a 100% stainless safety razor but they cost a few hundred dollars. So, until then, I am one of the unwashed (but not unshaved) masses who has to make due.
customer_reviews.author: Michael G.

customer_reviews.title: Buy This Razor
customer_reviews.text: Very light weight. Does not need to be warmed up like all metal razors. Looked all over and this is exactly what I wanted. Good price too.
customer_reviews.author: Cliff

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners.
customer_reviews.text: I would say that this razor is good for beginners like myself who are making that switch from cartridge razors to safety razors. Yes this is made of plastic, but the head is made of metal, and it's still heavier than multiblade razors, but lacks the heft that all metal safety razors have. I've had this for a month now, and it's given me good shaves, it's also easy to clean and maintain, and it's pretty affordable. So if you want to start using a safety razor, but aren't entirely comfortable shelling out $25+ for one, try this one, you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Pen name

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Budget DE Razor
customer_reviews.text: Goodbye expensive disposable razors! This is perfect for the everyday shaver looking to replace your expensive disposables. The first shave was perfect and I still don't even know how to properly use it. I had a few nicks but the cuts were so clean they did not bleed much at all. The "plastic" parts of this razor are a lot higher quality than I expected. This is definitely a keeper. Just remember it's not the same process as shaving with a disposable, but it is well worth the excellent shave this gives you and the money saved on disposables.
customer_reviews.author: Kayollan

customer_reviews.title: Better quality that the price might indicate.
customer_reviews.text: Works very well with Feather blades. Gives a very light weight and light touch and a very close shave.
customer_reviews.author: Richard S Matthews

customer_reviews.title: So although I can't speak to its finer points versus its competitors
customer_reviews.text: This was my first razor in the single-blade arena, after years using cartridges. So although I can't speak to its finer points versus its competitors, I can say: It shaves smoothly, it shaves comfortably, I don't cut myself with it, it was easy to figure out how to use it, it's inexpensive, and upon seeing it a friend commented "that's a really fancy razor!" What else do you need?
customer_reviews.author: Z!

customer_reviews.title: I really like it
customer_reviews.text: This is a real bargain for the quality of razor for the price. Toss in a couple of "Feather" brand blades and you got a real bargain. I like this razor far more than a top of the line safety razor I have (Merkur, IIRC). The Feather is lighter, but just fine after you get a bit used to it. Having a "butterfly" style opening makes it a snap to change blades and/or rinse out the razor. The Feather blades are my favorite, far better than Merkur, Derby, etc. For $20.00, you can't go wrong!
customer_reviews.author: Poor old dadTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Superb little performer
customer_reviews.text: Yes, there are some plastic parts but don't be fooled by that. This is a very capable razor, the blade aligns perfectly (not necessarily the case even in razors much more expensive). It's also very forgiving in the sense that you don't have to hold it in a "perfect" angle for it to do its job. The only minor complain might be that since the handle is plastic it's a little top heavy. The upside is that it's more agile and since I shave the "cabeza" too that suits me fine. Lastly, the blades that it comes with are super sharp, so much so that I prefer to use the Personna blades instead.
customer_reviews.author: Barplatt

customer_reviews.title: Much a better then the cheap ones.
customer_reviews.text: For the price a good product and I bought it as my travel shaver, but if you want a great shaver buy a Merkur shaver.
customer_reviews.author: 1_Deman

customer_reviews.title: Very good razor
customer_reviews.text: This razor with personna platinum chrome blades make a great team, for me. Close shave no blood. It's very handy that I don't have to take it apart to change blades. Cleans easily. One reviewer said his rusted. I've had this one over a year with no rust yet, I shave rinse it that's it, no rust. I also have the wilkenson sword razor that I like, but it doesn't shave as close and I hafta take it apart to change blades.
customer_reviews.author: Jawjadawg1950

customer_reviews.title: Very good razor for the price
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised the shave the razor gave and it even came with a couple of razor blades and a case that can be used for a travel razor. I didn't have any razor burn and I did my 3 pass shave. Don't let the plastic fool you its still a very good razor.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Extra Sharp
customer_reviews.text: I bought this based on a recommendation from Badger & Blade and Wow was I surprised. I gave me a better shave than any cartridge I have ever used.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: A very nice TTO razor
customer_reviews.text: I own the much more expensive Feather AS-D2 razor (among many other razors) and love it, but thought this one might be nice for travel. It seems to be a nice mild razor and decently made for the price. The TTO works well enough and it's a bit light, but shaves nicely enough. I have a fairly thick beard, but with a sharp blade and several passes this gets the job done nicely. Not as special as the AS -D2, but for about 1/10th the price it's nice enough.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product. When the Japanese do something
customer_reviews.text: My first transition to old-school double edge razors. Amazing product. When the Japanese do something, they do it well. Arigato Gozaimasu, Feather!
customer_reviews.author: Clark

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: I'm a female and I use this razor. It's nice and gets the job done. My husband has the Merkur which I've tried a few times. I think I prefer that one more. This one seems much lighter, as if you have to put a little more work in it. But it shaves well, the blades that come with it are nice. I've nicked myself maybe once or twice, but nothing serious. This is a nice starter blade, but I plan to move up when I get tired of this one.
customer_reviews.author: Tay

customer_reviews.title: Can't be that for the price
customer_reviews.text: For the price of that razor it can't be beat you don't even know your shaving it's really a good razor
customer_reviews.author: GC

customer_reviews.title: Great razor for me to start double edged shaving
customer_reviews.text: Great razor for me to start double edged shaving. There is a little learning curve. It's about the angle of the razor and the amount of pressure applied. I just could not spend $4.00 for a razor blade again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid razor with a big shave
customer_reviews.text: What a solid razor! I have larger hands, not huge, and it fits great. It has nice weight, but light. You can still let the razor do the work. I had other blades, and have not tried out the Feather brand razors provided, I've been using Shark brand razors. But, this has become one of my favorite razors to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great shaver
customer_reviews.text: I got fed up buying the expensive type razors that costs a ton of money and ended up buying this razor. first off I just want to say that this razor is well built. they designed it for simplicity and with ease to replace the double sided razor. I shave every day and shaving with these razors makes my skin sensitive afterwards but the shave is closer than any mach 3 or fusion 5 can get. only problem is it takes longer shaving this way than the other razors
customer_reviews.author: Renato T. Reyes

customer_reviews.title: A great first DE Razor
customer_reviews.text: This is my first double edge shaving razor and I really enjoy using it. I pair the razor with feather blades and the shaving action is smooth. I have learned not to press the razor into my skin but to let the razor glide weightlessly with multiple passes to achieve the best shaves. I am able to loosely adjust the aggressiveness of the shave by changing the angle of the blade on the razor. I experience less irritation from my shaving since switching from cartridge razors. I use a good shaving soap, as long as I shave mindfully I suffer few cuts. I certainly recommend this product to other budding double edged razor enthusiasts.
customer_reviews.author: Red Fox

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, Light Razor...Surprisingly good shave.
customer_reviews.text: This razor surprised and impressed me. Feather blades have always worked for my face, razor, blade equation, and I wanted to see how the handle held up. At first, I thought it would be too light. But after the first couple of shaves, I was impressed with how well it worked. The head of the razor places the blade at a good angle for shaving. If you're accustomed to using a heavier razor, this one may take a little getting used to. This replaces my travel razor (a Rimei, i think), and I also think it's a good, cheap razor to learn wet shaving.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S. Olson

customer_reviews.title: Just like the old days
customer_reviews.text: Just like the old days, close shave with only the inexpensive blades to dispose of. This Razor is a metal and plastic copy of the old twist to open Razors. Closer shave than disposables but takes a little more time as the blades are sharp and if you have never used this style razor it takes awhile to learn technique. Since I am an old geezer it was a breeze to transition.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas A. Renick

customer_reviews.title: Replaces cartridge shaving
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a cheaper alternative to cartridge shaving go ahead and buy this I ordered this feather double edge shaving razor and Astra razor blades for a little under 30bucks, I can shave with a new razor daily for the next 3+ months for under 30bucks, it is a great deal. I enjoy shaving with a single sharp razor over 4 blades like a cartridge I enjoy throwing away a used razor blade daily that only cost 10cents.
customer_reviews.author: WhatWouldJoeyDo

customer_reviews.title: Cant beat Japanese Quality
customer_reviews.text: Definitely on the mild side, just make sure to keep using feather blades which tear my face apart with other razors. Excellent value for the money!
customer_reviews.author: Josue Solano

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad product, Not the greatest
customer_reviews.text: This is my first razor I used to start wet shaving before I learned a lot of the art of it all. I warn anyone that doesn't understand wet shaving; feather blades are the sharpest out of the bunch. I recommend trying a sampler pack of blades to see how they shave. This is enough to test if feather is too much for you or not though. Not a bad product but it feels as if a plastic part is tugging on my face as I shave. I tried changing the blades to no avail. Bottom Line: I would recommend a different razor personally, but it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Daryn

customer_reviews.title: Great razor for beginners and womens legs
customer_reviews.text: Got one for me and my duafghter and will never buy a plastic razor again
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Roe

customer_reviews.title: A nice gentle razor that I would recommend to the veteran DE shaver or to the beginning DE shaver.
customer_reviews.text: A nice gentle TTO razor that I would recommend to the veteran DE shaver or to the beginning DE shaver. With the right blade for you this razor can give you a very nice shave. Get a good DE blade sampler pack and give this razor a try, I think you may be surprised by the quality of the shave.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas C.

customer_reviews.title: Wow , I  like
customer_reviews.text: Smooth shave, reminds me of when I was younger. easy to use, rinses well, good adjustment of cover and balde
customer_reviews.author: John A. Ramos

customer_reviews.title: Reunited and it feels so good...
customer_reviews.text: I started using disposables 30 years ago after I dropped my safety razor on the floor and broke it. Takes me a while to figure out what I'm missing, but thought I'd try this (reasonable price, good reviews, liked the design) and am glad I did: much closer shave with less pressure and effort, easier to clean between shaving strokes, and will probably end up being cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice razor
customer_reviews.text: For me this is a good razor! Very mild shaver and smooth. The razor is made of stainless steel and plastic. But don't let that turn you off. The head has a little heff to it due to the metal. The razor is light so don't feel you have to push hard on the razor. Very well contructed and closes down tightly. This would make an excellent travel razor.
customer_reviews.author: Rich E.

customer_reviews.title: I should have switched to this razor long ago!
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy it! I'm 46yo, tired of buying expensive disposables for decades wasting my money. This razor was shipped quickly, is sturdy, feels solid, not to light, well balanced. The mechanics are operate smoothly. No nicks or blood on my first try but I was a bit cautious then soon relaxed and simply shaved without worry! I recommend this razor, great price cant be beat, reputable company.
customer_reviews.author: Dean C.

customer_reviews.title: Don't let the price fool you!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the best d/e razor that have used thus far. I have always used disposable razors and I wanted to try shaving with d/e razors. Recently I purchased the Futur and was very impressed with its design and adjustable blade gaps. It was nice but not something I wanted to use everyday due to its weight. So I decided to purchase something for everyday use and came across the Feather. I am amazed with its ease and quality. What's really shocking is how awesome it cuts. I may be critized by saying this but for the price this razor bets my Futur hands down! The cut is close and nick-free. I wish I would have purchased this first!!!
customer_reviews.author: EJFaulkner

customer_reviews.title: Who knew it could be this effortless
customer_reviews.text: Been using a double edge razor that i bought local for 5 years. During those 5 years I've been removing bits of my face that i would've preferred to keep. Just got and shaved with my new Feather razor and immediately tossed my old razor. Short and sweet...closest and yet best feel of any shave known to man. Quite SHOCKED as a matter of fact. Who knew. If you're after close and comfortable, get this one.
customer_reviews.author: jeff

customer_reviews.title: Great for a beginner wet shaver.
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a starter DE razor. It performs great. It is a very mild shaver, and one must be real careless to get a cut, and careless to get burn. Feather blades, or blades that are real sharp, are a must for this razor, as it is that mild. It is plastic and will not last forever, however, at this very reasonable price, you will get your monies worth easily. Great for a beginner wet shaver.
customer_reviews.author: Renee B. Heal

customer_reviews.title: Great as a beginner razor
customer_reviews.text: Obviously not entirely metal, but cuts well even though very mildly and with the proper face prep almost impossible cut yourself unless you want to experiment by pushing hard into face or sliding side to side. The blade is held tight and does not need to be adjusted when the doors close as some metal DE razors do. IMO, it's milder than the all stainless steel Feather AS-D2 depending on how hard you want to go at the hair. Great as a beginner razor.
customer_reviews.author: GLC

customer_reviews.title: You Don't know What you are missing
customer_reviews.text: I got tired of buying the most expensive shaving razors and throwing them out after 2 or 3 uses I don't know if my beard changed as I got older or what anyway decided to give this a try and I'm delighted I get a real close shave and can get over 4 shaves with the same razor Happy and saving mucho $$$$$$
customer_reviews.author: G .  Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Beginner Model
customer_reviews.text: Mostly plastic, inexpensive, non-aggressive shaver. It's a Feather, and that's the reason I wanted to try it. Probably okay for the first time wet shaver, but I prefer a more aggressive rig. Not a fan of all that plastic. It feels too light in the hand. Don't get me wrong, it's far superior to the disposable razors and someone thinking of dipping their toe in the double edge pool would get a nice, safe intro to wet shaving.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Ven

customer_reviews.title: Amazing razor at an amazing price.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this razor with Prosaro green and Arko shave soap for a little over a month now. I don't know what a more expensive razor would do for me. I continually get a shave that is like a babies bottom. I use 4 passes and have not experienced a nic, razor burn or pimples. This razor used with Isreali Crystal blades ( and other blades as well ) has given me the best shave I can ask for.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Fried

product_meta.title: Feather Double Edge Shaving Razor
product_meta.description: The feather double-edge safety razor is a efficient butterfly opening safety razor that combines affordability with performance. Carefully designed for easy handling and superior grip, and built with quality materials including stainless steel. The butterfly loading mechanism is highly practical when loading or cleaning the razor. A perfect shaving instrument, in the feather tradition of high quality shaving instruments. It uses any modern double-edge blade.
feature_bullets: Feather double-edge razor by jatai comes with 2 hi-stainless blades
The cutting performance of the blades surpasses any other replacement blade razor on the market
Feather has created the most innovative razor in the world

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
